blog.name: artemisegeria
blog.title: This Is Not The Endgame
blog.description: Unapologetic Vision and Wanda Maximoff Stan

summary: Public Perception of the Avengers Post-Endgame (Spoilers)
title: Public Perception of the Avengers Post-Endgame (Spoilers)
body:
One thing that I debated soon after seeing Endgame was how the public would view the Avengers after they reversed the Snap. I could see it going one of two ways. On the one hand, public opinion was very negative after Johannesburg, Sokovia, and Lagos, and I can only imagine it got worse after the airport fight and the two years of the Rogues still being unapprehended. I could also see people thinking, “The Avengers attract intergalactic attention. None of this would have happened without them.” On the other hand, after the Snap and its reversal, people have much bigger problems to worry about. I could see people thinking of the Avengers’ powers as a beacon of hope and strength. Average people could give them credit for bringing back lost loved ones. 

I was running with the latter because it avoids a number of problems, but I think I actually have canonical support for it. In the new Far From Home trailer, there are several shots of shrines and memorials to Tony Stark. Now, those could be misdirection or the apparent good feeling could be aimed only at Tony, but I think it’s quite plausible that people have forgotten their past antipathy toward the Avengers and are grateful to them. So I’m just going to assume that the average person has a very favorable opinion of all the Avengers in the first few years after the events of Endgame. I’m also throwing in that this is the excuse to get rid of the Sokovia Accords, which the world’s governments may not want to devote resources to enforcing anyway. 

The next piece of support is far more tenuous, but it could be the case. I read an interview where Kevin Feige said the MCU won’t be introducing the X-Men for about five years. I don’t know how long that will end up being for in-universe time, but it would give a lot of time for public opinion to shift. I imagine that for 2-3 years post-Endgame (or a few movies), public opinion will continue to be highly favorable to the Avengers and enhanced people in general. Then, either one big event or several smaller events will start to shift it back to negative over the next 2-3 years (or few movies). This would set up a situation where the revised Sokovia Accords are ratified just in time for the X-Men to come in (whether from an alternate universe or the Snap did something that is causing gradual mutations or whatever other method they might use). Since anti-mutant sentiment seems to be an important part of most of their stories.

blog.name: menatiera
blog.title: Marvel Madness
blog.description:
MCU and other fandom stuff. Bucky is my fav, don't hurt him. ***
Header image is by the wonderful Tsumi-noaru: a beautiful illustration to my fae!fic for the Cap Big Bang in 2018. Check her works out, they're stunning!!! ***
Multishipper. She/Her. Hungarian. Lonely and will be grateful for all connections and attempts to talk to her! :)

summary: Some things never change, some things do - Menatiera - Marvel Cinematic Universe [Archive of Our Own]
title: Some things never change, some things do - Menatiera - Marvel Cinematic Universe [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Wordcount: Almost 5K (finished)
Fandom: Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies), Captain America (Movies)
Rating: Mature
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Relationships: James “Bucky” Barnes/Steve Rogers
Characters: James “Bucky” Barnes, Steve Rogers, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Sam Wilson (Marvel), Tony Stark (mentioned), Avengers Team (MCU)
Additional Tags: Avengers: Endgame (Movie) Spoilers, Post-Avengers: Endgame (Movie), Avengers: Endgame Fix-It, Endgame Fix-It, Avengers: Endgame (Movie), Everyone lives, Everyone Is Alive, And they get hugs, Hurt/Comfort, Happy Ending, so really it’s a soft and safe piece of writing imho, resolving my main issues with the film
Series: Part 3 of Fuck you, Russos!
Summary:

AVENGERS: ENDGAME SPOILERS - so summary is in the Author’s Note.
Yeah, you guessed it, I’m still not over fixing this movie in different ways.

This is also another Bucky Barnes Bingo fill - square Y3 - Sentiment. @buckybarnesbingo

Thank you for @rebelmeg and @slashergirl for looking through the first draft and encouraging me to finish it :)

summary: I'm going with my mum and step dad as we are going to the coast and making a full day of it and I know I'm going to end up...
question: I'm going with my mum and step dad as we are going to the coast and making a full day of it and I know I'm going to end up crying in front of them. To be completely honest I don't care if I do as I saw Infinity Wars at the cinemas with them and cried during that 🤣🤣 Oooo yeah I saw your post about commissions and I'm looking forward to all of them especially the Jim Kirk and Vulcan!Reader one as I'm a massive Star Trek fan - Lil Noddie
answer:
I went with my boyfriend and my cousin and I unabashedly cried. I warned them both ahead of time that I’d be a mess. It’s so good. 

I’m slowly submerging myself into the Trek fandom and I love it. I’ve been watching the original series with Shatner to really get a feel but I just wanna watch Pine xD though I’m catching up on spn 14 right now since it’s on Netflix over here. It’s a bit distracting tbh

blog.name: purenonsensefanfic
blog.title: What nonsense!
blog.description: A place for drabbles, fan fic, and any other nonsense that I write

title: Words Can Wait (Pt. 2)
body:
Warning: THIS IS INSPIRED BY AVENGERS: ENDGAME - so if you have not seen it yet and want to avoid spoilers, skip this one for now!

Pairing: Steve Rogers x Peggy Carter

Summary: Peggy Carter was having the most wonderful dream. 

Word Count: 575+

A/N: This ended up a bit sillier than I expected. Well, honestly, after Endgame, who couldn’t use something silly and sweet? Hang in there, this is only part 2! Please enjoy!

Part 1

Peggy stirred, eyes opening slowly. She found herself lying on her back on her loveseat, a velvet cushion propping up her head. She sighed and stared at the ceiling.

It was a dream, after all. She sighed again. Just another in a long line. Honestly, it’s silly to feel so sad about it! 

She closed her eyes. She knew that it was difficult to recall images from one’s dreams, but she was able to picture Steve’s face so clearly. And when she inhaled, she caught the faintest whiff of his scent, as well….

“Peggy?”

Her eyes flew open. Very slowly, she turned her head. 

Steve sat in the armchair next to her head. He smiled at her. “I thought I heard you wake. Are you all right?” Though he was smiling, his eyes were full of concern. 

Peggy blinked. “I… to be perfectly honest, I don’t know.” She sat up and rubbed her head. “I fear I have hit my head and slipped into a coma, or something else dreadful has happened to me, causing this… this delusion.” She looked at Steve. “But you’re so real.” She reached out and grabbed his hands with her own. 

Steve raised her hands to his mouth. Soft lips gently kissed her knuckles and she felt tears spring to her eyes. Please don’t wake up now!

“I am real. And I have so much to tell you. I know it’s only been a few days since…” Steve paused, his eyes lowered. “Since I missed our date.” 

Peggy hummed in affirmation, the tears in her eyes threatening to spill over. So far, this apparition was saying everything she’d dreamed she’d one day hear from Steve himself - ever since the day his plane went down. 

“But for me, it’s been a very long time.” Releasing her hands, Steve took a deep breath. His bright blue eyes held her own. “I just… god, Peggy, there’s so much I need to tell you, but right now all I want to do is - is this.” Steve suddenly slid forward, pulled her into his arms, and kissed her. 

Oh god, how divine! The feel of Steve’s strong arms around her, his broad shoulders under her hands, his delicious mouth on her own - Peggy could feel every single inch of him pressed against her. Her senses reeled. 

After a few moments, they parted, much to Peggy’s dismay. Steve stroked her cheek with his thumb. “Do you believe I’m real now?”

Peggy smiled sweetly, and Steve grinned in response. “Oh, darling.” She shook her head. “No.”

Steve blinked in confusion. “No?”

Peggy laughed. “Of course not! This is all far too perfect. It’s a dream.”

Steve leaned back, frowning. “I knew this would be hard to explain, but I didn’t think I’d have to convince you that I’m real!” He ran his hands through his hair in frustration. “What else can I do to prove to you that I’m here, right now, with you?” He looked at her with eyes full of hope and her heart ached. 

Bloody hell. I suppose now I *have* to wake up - if only to help soothe my imaginary love’s conscience. How did I end up here? 

Peggy thought for a moment. How could she determine dream from reality? What was the one thing that would never happen in her dreams?

The answer came to her then. She knew what to do, but she also knew he wouldn’t like it. 

Peggy squared her shoulders, looking Steve straight in the eye. 

“Hit me.”

“…WHAT?”

Steve leaned back, frowning. “I knew this would be hard to explain, but I didn’t think I’d have to convince you that I’m real!” He ran his hands through his hair in frustration. “What else can I do to prove to you that I’m here, right now, with you?” He looked at her with eyes full of hope and her heart ached. 

Bloody hell. I suppose now I *have* to wake up - if only to help soothe my imaginary love’s conscience. How did I end up here? 

Peggy thought for a moment. How could she determine dream from reality? What was the one thing that would never happen in her dreams?

The answer came to her then. She knew what to do, but she also knew he wouldn’t like it. 

Peggy squared her shoulders, looking Steve straight in the eye. 

“Hit me.”

“…WHAT?”
trail.content:
Warning: THIS IS INSPIRED BY AVENGERS: ENDGAME - so if you have not seen it yet and want to avoid spoilers, skip this one for now!

Pairing: Steve Rogers x Peggy Carter

Summary: Peggy Carter was having the most wonderful dream. 

Word Count: 575+

A/N: This ended up a bit sillier than I expected. Well, honestly, after Endgame, who couldn’t use something silly and sweet? Hang in there, this is only part 2! Please enjoy!

Part 1

Peggy stirred, eyes opening slowly. She found herself lying on her back on her loveseat, a velvet cushion propping up her head. She sighed and stared at the ceiling.

It was a dream, after all. She sighed again. Just another in a long line. Honestly, it’s silly to feel so sad about it! 

She closed her eyes. She knew that it was difficult to recall images from one’s dreams, but she was able to picture Steve’s face so clearly. And when she inhaled, she caught the faintest whiff of his scent, as well….

“Peggy?”

Her eyes flew open. Very slowly, she turned her head. 

Steve sat in the armchair next to her head. He smiled at her. “I thought I heard you wake. Are you all right?” Though he was smiling, his eyes were full of concern. 

Peggy blinked. “I… to be perfectly honest, I don’t know.” She sat up and rubbed her head. “I fear I have hit my head and slipped into a coma, or something else dreadful has happened to me, causing this… this delusion.” She looked at Steve. “But you’re so real.” She reached out and grabbed his hands with her own. 

Steve raised her hands to his mouth. Soft lips gently kissed her knuckles and she felt tears spring to her eyes. Please don’t wake up now!

“I am real. And I have so much to tell you. I know it’s only been a few days since…” Steve paused, his eyes lowered. “Since I missed our date.” 

Peggy hummed in affirmation, the tears in her eyes threatening to spill over. So far, this apparition was saying everything she’d dreamed she’d one day hear from Steve himself - ever since the day his plane went down. 

“But for me, it’s been a very long time.” Releasing her hands, Steve took a deep breath. His bright blue eyes held her own. “I just… god, Peggy, there’s so much I need to tell you, but right now all I want to do is - is this.” Steve suddenly slid forward, pulled her into his arms, and kissed her. 

Oh god, how divine! The feel of Steve’s strong arms around her, his broad shoulders under her hands, his delicious mouth on her own - Peggy could feel every single inch of him pressed against her. Her senses reeled. 

After a few moments, they parted, much to Peggy’s dismay. Steve stroked her cheek with his thumb. “Do you believe I’m real now?”

Peggy smiled sweetly, and Steve grinned in response. “Oh, darling.” She shook her head. “No.”

Steve blinked in confusion. “No?”

Peggy laughed. “Of course not! This is all far too perfect. It’s a dream.”

Steve leaned back, frowning. “I knew this would be hard to explain, but I didn’t think I’d have to convince you that I’m real!” He ran his hands through his hair in frustration. “What else can I do to prove to you that I’m here, right now, with you?” He looked at her with eyes full of hope and her heart ached. 

Bloody hell. I suppose now I *have* to wake up - if only to help soothe my imaginary love’s conscience. How did I end up here? 

Peggy thought for a moment. How could she determine dream from reality? What was the one thing that would never happen in her dreams?

The answer came to her then. She knew what to do, but she also knew he wouldn’t like it. 

Peggy squared her shoulders, looking Steve straight in the eye. 

“Hit me.”

“…WHAT?”

summary: Denial of Avengers: Endgame is the only reason I'm gonna be able to watch Spider-Man far from home without having a mental...
body:
Denial of Avengers: Endgame is the only reason I’m gonna be able to watch Spider-Man far from home without having a mental breakdown :’D

Me: Tony’s not dead, he’s resting, he’s gonna wake up

Ffh trailer: I just really miss him

Me: it’s okay Peter he’ll be back, get gonna wake up soon

News articles: things you didn’t notice about Tony’s death

What I hear: death rest

My hear aches everytime I even think that tony is dead forever, that Peter has lost yet someone else, it might cause him to be scared to lose Happy too and it just adds someone to Peter’s list to feel the need to protect. It hurts to think about.

So I think denial is really the best way to go about it cause then it doesn’t hurt. Bingo.

Also Tony Stark isn’t dead till 2023

blog.name: angels-twice-descending
blog.title: Amateur Professional
blog.description: Tessa | immortal | she/they | genderless blob | Queer | Fangirl | Writer | multifandom: Doctor Who, Spn, HP + non fandom sh*tposts (mostly reblogs)

body:
ENDGAME SPOILERS

I loved Endgame. It was epic. A great ending to a fantastic era. Except… there were a couple things I can never forgive the creators.

Tony’s death.

I will never get over it and I will forever stand by the opinion that Tony didn’t have to die. He was only killed for shock value. That’s the only reason. He was only killed because sad endings are a trend recently.

But… I needed a happy ending. I think we all did.

The thing with superhero movies is that you know, no matter what happens, no matter how hard the obstacles are, you can be sure the hero will win in the end. And there was already a film that didn’t go by that pattern. Infinity War. But that’s because there was a part two.

It would have made so much more sense for Tony’s arc for him to survive. To survive and finally give Pepper the life he promised her. Without the sleepless nights and Iron Man suits and the constant worry over another threat.

Even plotwise, Tony’s death was pointless. So many other characters could have snapped the Gauntlet and survived. Captain Marvel, Thor…

What’s worse is that even RDJ didn’t like Tony’s ending. The guy who made some of the best decisions regarding the character, the person who knows Tony best.

It was 100% done to hurt the audience. For shock value. For audience tears.

There have been sad movies. There have been movies with sad endings where the character died. But none have affected fans like this. So many people cannot sleep, are crying so much, are literally broken, because of this death. Because the writers and directors went against the expectations of a superhero movie.

They killed one of the most beloved MCU characters. And not even for a good reason.

summary: I'm an Art Snob Who Gave the MCU a Chance (and So Should You)
title: I'm an Art Snob Who Gave the MCU a Chance (and So Should You)
body:
It’s time for us art snobs to face facts: the MCU is better than we want to admit.

When you’ve spent a lifetime cultivating your perspective as a pretentious art fundamentalist, the Marvel Cinematic Universe doesn’t seem like it should find a comfortable place in your media consumption regimen.

I would know. My conversation is peppered with casual allusions to Homer, Joyce, and Achebe. When walking through a natural landscape, I find myself reflecting on whether the light on…

View On WordPress

title: Thanos question (Endgame spoilers)
body:
Exactly how powerful Thanos was?

He could be killed with Stormbreaker, but was that due to its “forged in the heart of a dying star with the mythical Uru ore” properties, or could any sharp and hard enough blade do the trick? Could Mjolnir have killed him? Could Nebula have killed him if she caught him off-guard and used a sharp and strong enough blade to decapitate him or hit him/stabbed him and did him enough vital organ damage?


Could Ronan have killed him with the Power Stone?


Thanos seemed resilient when he went hand-to-hand with the Hulk and took Tony’s attacks like they were mere scratches, but he already had the Gauntlet on with the Power Stone for both of those fights. Was he that physically resilient on an innate level? Were all Titans like him? Was he immortal himself and that’s why he went insane? How did he survive his planet’s destruction and why do we see no other survivors? Did he kill them all? How old is he?

Dammit I was hoping Endgame would answer all of this.

summary:
I like to believe now that he’s old, he’ll be such a pain in the ass. 
Steve: Can I have ice cream before dinner?
Sam and Bucky:...
body:
Old!Steve Rogers Headcanon

I like to believe now that he’s old, he’ll be such a pain in the ass. 

Steve: Can I have ice cream before dinner?

Sam and Bucky: No. 

Steve: But I’m going to DIE soon! 

Bucky: *tearing up* No, Steve, don’t say that! Here you go. *gives him five tubs of ice cream* 

Sam: *exasperated* You know this is emotional manipulation, right? 

Steve: *gumming on ice cream while Bucky hugs him* I know. :)

🚨ENDGAME SPOILERS🚨

i wanna talk about this-

WHY THRU THE ENTIRETY OF THE MCU SINCE CA:CW HAS THADDEUS ROSS BEEN UP IN ARMS ABOUT ARRESTING BUCKY FUCKING BARNES AND HERE HE STANDS AT TONYS FUNERAL 8FT BEHIND HIM AND NO ONE SAYS SHIT ABOUT IT???

I NEED ANSWERS!!! RUSSOS EXPLAIN.

summary: Okay guys, as it's been over 2 weeks since Endgame has come out, I will no longer tag it as spoilers. I will continue tagging it...
body: Okay guys, as it’s been over 2 weeks since Endgame has come out, I will no longer tag it as spoilers. I will continue tagging it as “avengers endgame” and “avengers: endgame” so please blacklist if you haven’t seen it yet :)

reblog.comment: Okay guys, as it’s been over 2 weeks since Endgame has come out, I will no longer tag it as spoilers. I will continue tagging it as “avengers endgame” and “avengers: endgame” so please blacklist if you haven’t seen it yet :)

trail.content_raw: Okay guys, as it’s been over 2 weeks since Endgame has come out, I will no longer tag it as spoilers. I will continue tagging it as “avengers endgame” and “avengers: endgame” so please blacklist if you haven’t seen it yet :)
